title: Family of student Riley Strain files wrongful death lawsuit against fraternity
summary: The family of student Riley Strain has filed a lawsuit against his fraternity, accusing Delta Chi of instilling a code that taught brothers “to abandon one another.”
story: The family of University of Missouri student Riley Strain has filed a wrongful death lawsuit against his fraternity, accusing Delta Chi of instilling a code that taught brothers “to abandon one another.”
The suit was filed in Boone County Circuit Court on Friday, almost a year to the day after Strain’s body was found in the Cumberland River in Nashville, following an extensive two-week search.

Strain, 22, had traveled to Nashville with fellow Delta Chi members for a spring formal, an annual event that the lawsuit described as involving “prolific consumption of alcohol.” Much of it was above 15% alcohol by volume, the suit said, even though Delta Chi’s risk management policy prohibits beverages with such high alcohol content from being served at fraternity events.
The suit names Delta Chi and more than two dozen fraternity leaders and members as defendants, accusing them of negligence that it says led to Strain’s death.

It accuses the fraternity of failing to ensure that the chapter was following a strict safety protocol, failing to enforce its written policies and “instilling a code into its fraternity members that encouraged or taught fraternity ‘brothers’ to abandon one another instead of helping one another,” among other allegations.

The suit accuses the fraternity members of encouraging Strain to continue drinking “after it became apparent that he was acting in an unusual way,” failing to arrange a ride back to the hotel for him after he got kicked out of a bar when he was out with fraternity friends and delaying a 911 call to report him missing.

A representative for Delta Chi did not immediately respond to a request for comment, nor did attorneys for Strain’s family. At the time of Strain’s death, Delta Chi released a statement saying it was “deeply saddened by the tragic passing of our esteemed fraternity brother” and said that it was providing support and resources to those affected.

An attorney for the family, Jacob Lewis, declined to comment, as did Strain’s stepfather, Christopher Whiteid, who is one of four plaintiffs. The other three plaintiffs — Strain’s mother, Michelle Whiteid, his father, Robert Gilbert, and his stepmother, Melissa Gilbert — did not respond to requests for comment.

The legal complaint describes Strain as an “often-reserved young man that did not tend to go with the typical fraternity flow,” whose fraternity brothers convinced him to come on the chartered bus trip to Nashville for the formal. On the bus ride from Columbia, Missouri, the suit said, Delta Chi members served beer and jello shots they had made with vodka, which has well over 15% alcohol by volume.

The lawsuit goes on to say that Strain was offered several drinks, and fraternity members noticed him having difficulty speaking and walking within hours of arriving in Nashville, but brought him along as they went bar-hopping. When a bar made Strain leave later that night, his fraternity brothers “chose to continue partying” instead of making sure he was safe, the lawsuit states.
“Rather than having the support of his brothers, Riley was abandoned and alone,” it said.

Instead of heading toward the hotel, Strain made a wrong turn and began walking toward the river, the lawsuit said. When his hotel roommates returned around 1 a.m. and saw he had not completed what should have been a 12-minute walk back to the hotel despite leaving the bar about three hours earlier, there was “no search, no panic,” and no call made to 911, according to the suit.

“The fraternity brothers did not even think to call Riley’s parents, they simply got ready for bed and went to sleep,” it said, adding Strain’s parents and police in Nashville were notified the following afternoon.
Strain was eventually found facedown in the Cumberland River. An autopsy report revealed he died “as a result of drowning and ethanol intoxication,” also known as alcohol poisoning.

Luke’s 32 Bridge Food + Drink in Nashville, the bar that Strain was last seen at, released a statement last year while Strain was still missing saying that he was served one alcoholic drink and two glasses of water before he was escorted out by security “based on our conduct standards.”
The autopsy report said his death appeared to be accidental and did not indicate any signs of foul play.
Strain’s family is seeking a jury trial and unspecified damages plus compensation for the pain and suffering Strain experienced before he died.

title: Two former Michigan athletes allege intimate images were stolen by ex-football coach
summary: Former University of Michigan assistant football coach Matt Weiss pleaded not guilty to federal charges Monday as two women filed a class-action lawsuit alleging they were victims of a scheme to access private student accounts.
story: Former University of Michigan assistant football coach Matt Weiss pleaded not guilty to federal charges Monday as two women filed a class-action lawsuit alleging they were victims of a scheme to access private student accounts.

Weiss was charged in a 24-count indictment last week after federal prosecutors accused him of accessing the digital accounts of 3,300 student-athletes to download their intimate photos and videos. He pleaded not guilty on all charges and was released on a $10,000 unsecured bond, court records show.
Two women sued Weiss, the university, its Board of Regents and the company that managed the information of student athletes Weiss is accused of using to download personal information.
The women are "embarrassed, ashamed, humiliated, and mortified" that their private information has been accessed by total strangers and third parties, the lawsuit says.

Federal investigators accused Weiss of using the passwords of his colleagues with elevated access to the student-athlete database to download personally identifiable information and medical data of more than 150,000 athletes.
According to Weiss' indictment, he used the information to gain unauthorized access to more than 3,000 accounts belonging to students and alumni.
He then downloaded their private, intimate photos or videos from their email, social media or cloud storage accounts, the indictment said.
Weiss was fired in January 2023, The Associated Press reported.

The two women, identified only as "Jane Doe 1" and "Jane Doe 2," filed the suit in the Eastern District of Michigan as a potential class action claim. One is a former Michigan gymnast from 2017 to 2018, and the other is a Michigan soccer player who was on the school's team from 2017 to 2023.

Their suit alleges multiple violations of the law by Weiss and the other parties, including violations of Title IX protections, violations of their civil rights and violation of civil laws such as the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.
The University of Michigan and Keffer Development Services were accused of gross negligence in their handling of student data.

“The recklessness and negligence and misconduct of the Regents, the University, and Keffer in these respects enabled Weiss to target female college athletes to obtain their private and sensitive information without authorization, including but not limited to Plaintiffs,” the suit says.
Kay Jarvis, the university’s public affairs director, said the school has not been served with the suit and "cannot comment on pending litigation."
An attorney for Weiss did not immediately respond to a request for comment about the case Monday. Keffer Development Services did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: Nikki Glaser says she fears getting death threats or detained over political humor
summary: Nikki Glaser said that she is thinking twice about performing political jokes, including those about President Donald Trump, over fears of getting death threats or being detained.
story: Nikki Glaser said that she is thinking twice about performing political jokes, including those about President Donald Trump, over fears of getting death threats or being detained.
The comedian was at the gala for the 26th Mark Twain Prize for American Humor at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., on Sunday to celebrate honoree Conan O’Brien.
But the mood took a more serious turn when she opened up on the red carpet about her concerns with using political humor, according to Deadline.
“Like, you just are scared that you’re gonna get doxxed and death threats or who knows where this leads, like, detained. Honestly that’s not even like a joke," Glaser told reporters.

"It’s like a real fear. So it’s unfortunate that that’s true, but I’m not gonna lie and say I don’t think about that sometimes ... I can be up on the gallows and say, 'I was just joking. I’m a comedian.’ I hope that that’s a defense.”
Glaser told The Hill on Sunday that she misses being open about her point of view and formerly "felt safe speaking to that."

“I went from being like, ‘I don’t want to talk about politics because I don’t want to alienate anyone,’ to like, ‘I want to talk about it but now I’m scared to.’ And that’s just that’s a s---ty place to be,” she added.
Trump announced in February that he would be appointing himself chairman of the Washington-based performing arts center, firing multiple members of the board of trustees.
O’Brien told reporters that he has no control over what his colleagues would say during the night, according to Deadline.
“Well, I don’t have any say of what any of my friends are doing,” he said.

Following Glaser's remarks on the carpet, some fellow comedians took the opportunity to mock the new administration. Sarah Silverman included a jab in her speech addressed to O'Brien, saying, “I just really miss the days when you were America’s only orange a--hole,” according to Yahoo Entertainment.
Other comedians in attendance include Bill Burr, Stephen Colbert, Sean Evans, Will Ferrell, David Letterman, Kumail Nanjini, Tracy Morgan, John Mulaney, Adam Sandler, Andy Richter and Reggie Watts.
The program will premiere on Netflix on May 4, according to the Kennedy Center.

title: When and what time is Grant Ellis’ ‘The Bachelor’ finale?
summary: Who will Grant Ellis propose to in the upcoming three-hour season finale of “The Bachelor?” Find out how to tune into the dramatic conclusion.
story: Who will Grant Ellis propose to in the upcoming three-hour season finale of “The Bachelor?” Well, based on the previews, he will be torn about the decision up until the moment he kneels on one knee.
All season long, “The Bachelor” has shown glimpses of an “incredibly emotional” ending, as host Jesse Palmer says in the teaser, to Grant’s journey to find love.
Grant, a 31-year-old day trader from Newark, New Jersey, developed strong feelings for his remaining two women, Litia Garr and Juliana Pasquarosa, over the last few episodes.

Leading into the finale, which was filmed in the Dominican Republic, Grant told Litia he was in love with her, suggesting she might receive his final rose. But, he has also repeatedly expressed that he could see Juliana as his wife.

“Juliana makes me feel special and I see her as the mother of my children,” he says in the preview. “Litia is a picture of what I came in here looking for. She makes me feel like there’s a future in her. And I can’t wait to see what the future holds.”

In the live finale, Bachelor Nation will watch Grant introduce both ladies to his parents and older sister as he tries to figure out which woman is his soulmate. Then, Grant, Litia and Juliana will reunite and join Palmer to unpack all the drama and heartbreak during the “After the Final Rose” special.
Want to make sure you don’t miss the conclusion to Grant’s season? Find out how to tune in, below.
When is Grant’s finale of ‘The Bachelor?’
The three-hour live finale of Grant’s season of “The Bachelor” will air on Monday, March 24.
What time is ‘The Bachelor’ finale?
The finale and “After the Final Rose” special will begin at 8 p.m. ET and end at 11 p.m. ET.
How to watch the finale
The final episode of Season 29 will air on ABC. “Bachelor” fans can also stream the episode the next day on Hulu.

title: Amy Schumer opens up about taking Mounjaro: 'Wanted to keep it real with you'
summary: Amy Schumer shared her positive experience being on Mounjaro, a prescription drug that's approved to treat Type 2 diabetes and also commonly prescribed for weight loss.
story: Amy Schumer is sharing her experience taking Mounjaro — a prescription drug that's approved to treat Type 2 diabetes and also commonly prescribed for weight loss — after being vocal about the side effects she experienced on other similar medications.

In a March 21 Instagram video, the 43-year-old actor and comedian described having a "really good experience" on Mounjaro after previously not being able to "handle" the side effects of Wegovy, a popular weight loss drug.

“I wanted to share, and keep it 100 with you, that years ago — and yes, this is completely unsafe to be driving and making a video — years ago, three years ago, I tried Wegovy and I was like puking,” Schumer said.
“I couldn’t handle it. I don’t know if they’ve changed the formula or whatever," she added.

After her unsuccessful experience with Wegovy, the "Kinda Pregnant" star arranged a telehealth meeting with Midi Health, a virtual care clinic specializing in perimenopause and menopause. (Schumer later disclosed that she ended up investing in the company after the appointment.)

“They put me on estrogen and progesterone because I realized I was in perimenopause and my symptoms of being in perimenopause have disappeared,” she said, adding that she also has been taking Mounjaro.
"My hair is fuller, my skin is better, I have more energy. I want to 'get down' more, if you know what I mean,” said Schumer, adding, “I’m talking about sex.”
“I’m having a really good experience, so I wanted to keep it real with you about that,” said Schumer.

Many have turned to telehealth sites to obtain a prescription for drugs that can help with weight loss. Anyone seeking a prescription for a weight loss drug online should first speak with a trusted health care provider.
Schumer's health update comes more than a year after she described the side effects she experienced on Ozempic during a June 2023 episode of "Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen."
“I was one of the people that felt like sick, I couldn’t like play with my son,” she said, noting that the drug succeeded in making her "so skinny."
“You’re like, ‘OK this isn’t livable for me,’ but I immediately invested because I’m like, ‘Everyone and their mom is going to try it,’” she added.

title: Drake Bell and Josh Peck break silence on relationship, 'Quiet on Set' in emotional reunion
summary: Drake Bell and Josh Peck reunited for an emotional conversation covering Quiet on Set, their friendship now and Nickelodeon.
story: Nearly 20 years after the end of the Nickelodeon series “Drake & Josh,” former co-stars Drake Bell and Josh Peck reunited for a two-part of episode Peck’s “Good Guys“ podcast. In it, they discussed their relationship and the fallout from the documentary series “Quiet on Set: The Dark Side of Kids TV.”

In “Quiet on Set,” which aired on ID in April 2024, Bell came forward as the unnamed minor in the 2004 sexual abuse case against former acting and dialogue coach Brian Peck (no relation to Josh Peck).
Brian Peck pleaded no contest to two charges of sexual abuse in October 2004 and was found guilty of both. He spent 16 months in prison and was made to register as a sex offender.
During the first episode of the podcast, released March 24, Bell situated the abuse case within his relationship with Josh Peck and his larger Nickelodeon career.
Bell said he told his mom about Brian Peck’s abuse, kicking off the investigation, between the end of “The Amanda Show” in 2002 and the premiere of “Drake & Josh” in 2004.
The pending investigation with Brian Peck impacted Bell’s ability to be present on the set of “Drake & Josh,” he said. In the show, Bell and Josh Peck play stepbrothers and polar opposites.

“The whole time I’m working with doing the pilot I know that there’s an investigation happening. I know that this guy’s (Brian Peck) about to get arrested. I know that s–t is about to hit the fan, and nobody in here knows it,” Bell said.
Meanwhile, Josh Peck said he perceived Bell’s behavior as distance — that is, until he saw the recent documentary.

“I was just looking at it through the prism of a 14-year-old’s brain like, ‘He doesn’t want much to do with me,’” Josh Peck explained. “In watching the documentary at 38, as a father, as a grown-up, so much was revealed to me of what you had to go through. I can’t even imagine that.”

Bell, at the time, was afraid the investigation would go public and impact “Drake & Josh.” While filming, Bell said he lost his hair and got scabs on his head, which Bell’s doctor attributed to stress.
“It was ever present,” Bell told Peck about the investigations when filming “The Amanda Show.”
Bell also discussed his worries about how the investigations would affect “Drake & Josh.”
“I’m doing the thing that I’ve always wanted to do, and I’ve got my partner to do it with,” Bell disclosed. “When this drops, is Josh (Peck) going to look at me like, ‘Bro, you took our dream away.’”
Despite his fears, Bell’s identity wasn’t revealed until he came forward in 2024.
“Drake & Josh” ended in 2007. The two co-stars made public reunions, like at Nickelodeon events and in Josh Peck’s show “Grandfathered.”

They had a fallout in 2017, however, when Josh Peck did not invite Bell to his wedding, and Bell fired off a series of since-deleted tweets. According to E! News at the time, Bell wrote, “When you’re not invited to the wedding the message is clear.”
Josh Peck said in a 2022 “BFFs“ podcast episode that he didn’t invite Bell to his wedding “because I hadn’t really talked to him in many, many years.”

“Cut to: I’m getting married that night and I see these text messages from him cursing me out, coming for me on the night of my wedding. And I’m like, ‘Yo.’ And it’s delusional because I’m like, ‘Bro, we worked at Coffee Bean when we were 16. I’m sorry, I’m 31 now. I might’ve lost your number,’” he continued.
At the time, Josh Peck made it seem like he and Bell were not on good terms.

“‘Drake & Josh’ is something I’ll be synonymous with forever and I’m proud of it,” he said. “And I want to like the guy that my name is attached to forever, but unfortunately, it just sort of worked out the way that it did.”
He also asked Bell to apologize to his wife at the MTV Video Music Awards after the wedding.

Bell reacted to Josh Peck’s comments in an interview with “Hollywood Raw” in 2023, saying that he “never texted him, cursing him out the night of his wedding because I didn’t know that there was a wedding until he posted about it the next day.”
The two don’t address the wedding in the first part of the podcast. However, they speak about “Drake & Josh’s” legacy.
Bell said when supporters say they’ll never watch “Drake & Josh” again, he tells them to do otherwise.
“That was actually where I was comfortable and happy and stoked, and I’m very proud of what we did,” Bell said to Josh Peck while tearing up.
“It was very special and you can’t recreate it,” Josh Peck replied.
The second part of the conversation drops March 27.

title: Wilson Phillips sings 'Hold On' with Carnie Wilson’s daughter during her ‘American Idol’ audition
summary: Two-thirds of Wilson Phillips helped out when Carnie Wilson's daughter Lola tried out for "American Idol" and they all sang "Hold On."
story: The early ‘90s burst onto the scene March 23 on “American Idol” when two-thirds of the group Wilson Phillips helped a relative during her audition.
The contestant, named Lola, appeared with her dad, Rob, who was holding a guitar, prompting judge Carrie Underwood to guess Lola came “from a musical family.”

After Underwood asked what song she would be singing, Lola said she had to bring in some family members to help her out. A few moments later, Lola came back in with her mom, Carnie Wilson, and her aunt, Wendy Wilson. Both women, of course, are the daughters of Beach Boys legend Brian Wilson and were in Wilson Phillips, along with Chynna Phillips.
The Wilsons’ presence threw Underwood and fellow judges Luke Bryan and Lionel Richie for a loop.
“I don’t know how to proceed right now,” the “Before He Cheats” singer said.
Lola, her parents and aunt took care of that, teaming up to sing the 1990 Wilson Phillips smash “Hold On.”
“You might know this song,” Carnie Wilson joked beforehand.

After they wrapped up, Carnie and Wendy Wilson both said they love singing as a family, but “love Lola by herself even more,” which prompted Underwood to say she would like to hear Lola sing by herself.
Her family then walked off to the side, setting the stage for Lola, 19, to audition on her own by covering Kacey Musgraves’ “Rainbow.”
Lola certainly didn’t need any family to help make an impression, either.
“You’ve got everything you need,” Richie said after she finished, while encouraging her to sing some notes longer.

“The tone and the pureness and the quality of your voice, that’s a perfect song for you. But this competition is going to require you to belt, too, and kind of let loose a little bit, fill up the room a little more and using your dynamics. But you got a really, really beautiful voice,” Bryan said.

“You have an honesty in your voice and in your presence. I want to see you own your talent and everything that you have to offer, because you have a lot to offer. And it makes me really excited to get to potentially bear witness to that,” Underwood said.
“If I’m on the show, I will push myself. That’s why I want to be on ‘American Idol.’ I want to grow,” Lola said.
The three judges didn’t need much convincing — they all voted yes, sending Lola to Hollywood for the next round.

This marks the second time this season a pop star has joined a child for an "American Idol" audition. Earlier this month, Backstreet Boys star Brian Littrell teamed up with his son, Baylee, who also made it to the next round.
Time will tell how far Lola makes it in the competition, but mom Carnie Wilson was delighted that she wanted to try out because she's growing as an artist.
"She's got something so honest and pure and lovely," she told "Entertainment Tonight."
"I could not be more excited for her," she added.

For those keeping score, "Hold On" was one of Wilson Phillips' biggest hits. It spent one week atop the Billboard Hot 100, joining "Release Me" and "You're in Love" as tracks that went to No. 1 on the chart for the group.

title: What is ‘Million Dollar Secret’? About the competition show's cast, premise and more
summary: What is Netflix’s new competition reality show "Million Dollar Secret"? About the new series including where it was filmed and the rule
story: Netflix’s new competition reality show "Million Dollar Secret" looks like the streamer’s answer to "The Traitors."
Like “The Traitors,” the series unfolds at a luxurious estate — only instead of a Scottish castle, we're in a lakeside estate in Kelowna, Canada.

And rather than rooting out a traitor, the cast of "Million Dollar Secret" has to find the single millionaire among them. The series involves manipulation, rooting out secrets and facing physical challenges, like chipping away at glaciers and being chased by a hound (yes, really).
Here’s everything you need to know about this new series.
What are the rules of 'Million Dollar Secret'?
The gist is simple: One of the 12 cast members is chosen to be a "millionaire," and everyone else tries to find out who it is.
The millionaire is (seemingly) chosen by chance. As contestants arrive at the estate, each chooses a key from host Peter Serafinowicz that goes to a different room.
Eleven of those rooms have a box that that is completely empty. One holds a million dollar prize.

Each day, contestants compete in challenges to win opportunities that will lead them closer to identifying the millionaire. At night, the contestants sit around the dinner table and choose who they think holds the prize. Whoever receives the most votes is eliminated. If successful, the pot is reshuffled to a remaining contestant. If not, the millionaire lives to see another day.

The millionaire also has their own secret agenda that they can complete to gain an advantage during eliminations. However, they must tread lightly as the other contestants are looking out for any odd behaviors that might give the millionaire away.
Who is the cast?
The cast spans all ages and occupations, and each arrive with their own competitive strategy to clinch the million.

title: Heather Tom on ‘really special’ – and historic – ‘Bold and the Beautiful’ episode that honors her mom
summary: Heather Tom talks in an interview with TODAY.com about celebrating her 35th year on daytime TV in a big way: by directing, writing and starring in a "B&B" episode.
story: Heather Tom is celebrating her 35th year on daytime TV in a big way.
The actor says she will make history March 27 when "The Bold and the Beautiful" airs an episode she wrote, directed and starred in.
“This is the first time it’s ever happened in daytime. Across any television platform, it’s only happened a handful of times for women," Tom, who plays Katie Logan on the show, tells TODAY.com.
The 49-year-old pulls triple duty in the special episode, which is all about the female stars of the show and centers on the theme of mothers and daughters.

“We have the Steffy (Jacqueline MacInnes Wood) and Taylor (Rebecca Budig) characters, and they’re kind of in a state of euphoria because they’ve pulled off something that’s very dear to them and it worked,” Tom tells TODAY.com of the mother-daughter duo. “And then we have the Brooke (Katherine Kelly Lang) and the Hope (Annika Noelle) characters who are just kind of in complete and utter turmoil. So it’s a nice juxtaposition between the two.”
Tom says she couldn't help but think of her late mother while working on the episode. She even pays tribute to her in a scene she shares with Jennifer Gareis, who plays her character's sister Donna.
“I was able to get a little bit of an homage to my mother, who passed away last year," she says, calling the experience "really special."
Tom describes her mother as a "very determined" and "very smart" woman, calling her "the reason" she's in the entertainment industry.

Directing and acting in the episode after writing it was a challenge for Tom, who made her directorial debut on "B&B" in 2016. Since then, she's directed over 30 times and written multiple episodes of the show. In addition to her work on “B&B,” Tom has also directed episodes of “The Young and the Restless,” “Dynasty” and “Good Trouble.”

"I’m so grateful and honored that Brad (Bell, the show's executive producer and head writer) would even try to do something like this because logistically, it was a feat. But everyone came together and was so supportive, and we pulled it off really seamlessly," she says.
Tom worked alongside another female director to map out all the shots and had a monitor on set to help her keep track of her own scenes while she was acting.

"It's a very emotional show. I really wanted to make sure that our scenes were blocked and really rehearsed so that the actresses who had to be so emotional knew that they could just get it in one shot," she says.
Tom is particularly thrilled that the episode is airing during Women’s History Month.
“I feel like we really need to celebrate women, especially right now, and I think that our history and our needs are something that we should highlight and celebrate,” she says.

Tom's career is certainly one that's worth celebrating. Before joining the cast of "B&B" in 2007, the actor appeared on "One Life to Live" and "All My Children." She also starred as Victoria Newman on "The Young and the Restless" alongside Joshua Morrow, who played her on-screen brother Nick Newman.

In 2024, Morrow's son Crew Morrow joined the cast of "B&B" as Tom's on-screen son, creating a "full-circle" moment for Tom, especially since her new co-star's mannerisms often remind her of his father.
"They really hit it out of the park with this one, and he’s wonderful. I’m so thrilled that he’s on the show,” she says.
Tom, who has won six Daytime Emmy Awards, says it's "kind of mind-boggling" to think that she's been on daytime TV for 35 years.
“I’m super grateful to have had a steady gig for all that time," she says.
The actor is grateful to play “such a dynamic character” and says she has a few favorite storylines from her time on the show.

“(Katie’s) heart transplant was really pivotal for the character, and I’m really glad that they have made that a part of her narrative the entire time, and not just been like, ‘Oh yeah, this happened,' and then forget about it,” she explains.
Tom also appreciates her character’s postpartum depression storyline.

“Granted, she had postpartum psychosis, so it was way extreme, but I just feel like it’s still really one of the last things that is kind of taboo to talk about. I think so many women go through it, and they feel like they can’t talk about it because somehow it’s going to mean you’re a bad mother or that you don’t love your kid. And it’s really not about that at all," she says.
Looking to the future, Tom sees "a lot of potential" for her character's continued growth, especially with her son, Will, back in the picture now.
“I’d like to see Will become a little bit more like his dad. I think that would create conflict for Katie," she says.
With her brother and sister, David and Nicholle Tom, also in the entertainment industry, it begs the question: Will the trio work together on a project in the future?
“I would love to collaborate with them on anything!” Tom says, calling her siblings “so talented.”

For now, Tom's schedule is pretty packed with her work on "B&B." Although writing, directing and starring in an episode was no small feat for the actor, she’s excited to tackle the challenge again one day.
“I certainly would welcome doing it again. But in the meantime, I am directing and still writing and still acting on the show. So I am doing all three, just not at once,” she says.

title: Benny Blanco gets rid of his unibrow with fiancée Selena Gomez's help — watch the video
summary: Benny Blanco has his eyebrows plucked as fiancée Selena Gomez watches in a new TikTok video.
story: Benny Blanco is showing off his newly groomed eyebrows in a before-and-after beauty video co-starring his supportive fiancée, Selena Gomez.
The 37-year-old music producer underwent a major tweezing session with Gomez by his side, documenting it all in a recent TikTok video.
The clip kicks off with shaggy-haired Blanco sitting in a chair and showing viewers his hairy unibrow. "OK, guys, here's the 'before,'" he says, holding the camera close to his face.
A beat later, viewers see a stylist's hands readying Blanco's eyebrows with a small brush as Gomez, 32, stands beside them. "Do it light," Gomez tells the stylist, "because I love him."
The stylist begins plucking ... and plucking ... and plucking at the scraggly hairs between Blanco's brows. "Oww!" Blanco says before the camera focuses on his red and irritated skin.
The video then shows the stylist shaping Blanco's brows with a small comb.
"What are you doing? a confused Blanco mutters under his breath.
"Are we almost done?" he says more loudly seconds later. After the stylist begins plucking his brows again, Blanco lets out a final "oww!"
The video concludes with the producer-songwriter showing off his clean new eyebrow area.
"I can't even tell the difference," he says looking at himself. "Can you guys?"
Blanco's fans couldn't help but tease him, noting that his eyebrows had, indeed, undergone a noticeable transformation.
"Respectfully, yes, we can tell the difference," one joked in the comments, while someone else added, "Looks so much better, Benny."
Many of the lovebirds' fans noted Gomez's sweet remark asking the stylist not to tweeze too much.
"Selena coming in and saying 'go light because I love him' has to be the purest thing I've heard. She does not want that man to ever change," one wrote.
Blanco and Gomez stopped by TODAY on March 21 to promote their new joint album, "I Said I Love You First," released the same day.
During their visit to Studio 1A, the couple revealed that it was Gomez who said "I love you" first in their relationship, but the moment happened while she was under anesthesia.

"When we first started dating, she had hand surgery and she was coming out of anesthesia, and she just goes, ‘I love you.’ And I said, ‘What?’ And she goes, ‘I love you.’ I was like, ‘Go back to bed,'" recalled Blanco.
Gomez tripped up and said the phrase a few more times by "mistake" while Blanco was building up the courage to say it himself, he added.

"Then I was in New York City, and I was like, ‘OK, I’m going to do it.’ I have this whole thing planned. And I was laying in bed with her and we’re about to say it and she says it before me,” he said, adding, “She steals my moment."

title: Jenna shows her dislocated finger on TODAY: ‘Now I’ve broken 3 of my 10 fingers’
summary: Jenna Bush Hager showed off the dislocated middle finger on TODAY that "just wanted to match" the one she busted on her other hand in fourth grade.
story: Jenna Bush Hager showed off the dislocated middle finger on TODAY that "just wanted to match" the one she busted on her other hand in fourth grade.

Jenna was wearing a blue splint on the middle finger on her left hand on the March 24 episode of TODAY with Jenna & Friends as she was joined by her twin sister, Barbara Pierce Bush, who served as guest co-host.
"You may notice that I'm wearing a splint, which maybe I'll have you sign during commercial break," Jenna told her sister.
Jenna told TODAY.com she suffered the injury while on vacation.
"Well, I unfortunately dislocated my middle finger," she said on TODAY.
"Yes, I received a text message about it," Barbara replied.
Jenna then shared a photo of the mangled finger, which was not for the faint of heart.
"I may put a warning on because they're going to show the picture," Jenna said ahead of the reveal.
"If you're queasy, don't look at your television for the photo," Barbara added.
"This is what happened to my finger," Jenna said to groans in the background as the picture of her gnarled finger was shown on TODAY.
Unfortunately for Jenna, she has experience with this type of injury.
"Some people may think, 'Wow that's the first time anything's ever happened to your finger,'" Jenna said.
"But they would be wrong," Barbara said.
Jenna said the health professionals examining her couldn't help but notice this wasn't her first broken finger.
"In the X-ray, the guy said, 'Seems you have a lot of hairline fractures in this finger,'" Jenna said. "And I said, 'Well now I've broken three of my 10 fingers.'"
"Things come in threes, so hopefully this is it for you," Barbara said.
Barbara remembers the last time Jenna suffered an injury to one of her middle fingers.
"In fourth grade, you were waving out the window at mom and dad and me, and you had unfortunately a strong track record of claiming you were injured," she said.
"Well, sometimes I was," Jenna said.
"That one time you were, so we didn't believe you. We thought you were playing wolf because you did like attention," Barbara responded.
The one in fourth grade was all too real, and now she has one as an adult.
"And I actually had broken my other middle finger," Jenna said about her injury as a child. "They just wanted to match."
"Perfect," Barbara added. "They're symmetrical."

title: What to know about Owen Cooper, the teenage breakout star of 'Adolescence'
summary: Who is Owen Cooper? About the star of Adolescence including how old he is, his audition tape, how he got the part and more.
story: Owen Cooper may be new to your screen, debuting his first acting role as Jamie Miller in "Adolescence," but he's already captivating audiences.

Cooper's performance as a 13-year-old accused of murdering his classmate has been praised by fans and critics alike. Jamie appears to flicker back and forth between a helpless child and an angry young man capable of murder, constantly throwing characters, and audiences, off.
Anita Singh of The Telegraph wrote that Cooper gives a "truly remarkable performance" and social media has been ablaze with users applauding his role.

"Watching #adolescencenetflix and this kid Owen Cooper… not only is this his first acting gig but every episode of this show is shot in ONE continuous take… he is gonna have an Oscar one day he is f---ing incredible!" one X user tweeted.
How did this rising star get to where he is? What do his cast mates think about his performance? Read on to see.
How old is Owen Cooper?

"Adolescence" filmed from March to September 2024, when Cooper was 14 years old. Cooper is currently 15, which Stephen Graham, the show's co-creator, co-writer and star, confirmed to TODAY on March 21.
Acting wasn't always Cooper's dream. Originally, he told Variety, he wanted to be a professional soccer player, but felt compelled to take acting lessons years ago.
"I don’t know what it was that made me want to do it, but I just wanted to do it," he said.
After signing with an agency, his self-tape for "Adolescence" launched his career.
What has Owen Cooper said about 'Adolescence'?

Cooper told Vanity Fair that he is the “complete opposite” of Jamie, but he had to put himself in Jamie’s shoes for the part. Cooper detailed filming the scene in which his onscreen parents Eddie (Stephen Graham) and Manda Miller (Christine Tremarco) first see Jamie get arrested.

“Steven and Christine are banging on the window, saying, ‘We’re here!’” Cooper told Vanity Fair. “And, I don’t know, that just really got me ... I looked at them as my mum and dad. It made me think I was all on my own and I was just isolated from all my parents. So I don’t really think of it as being Jamie. I think of it as myself in that situation.”
In a video shared by Netflix, Cooper reacted to his own audition tape — cringing at the acting and his hair.
"I hated that," Cooper said, watching the moment back.
Despite disliking watching himself at his audition, Cooper told Variety that he's watched his performance in the show.

"Everyone’s been saying such nice things," he said. "My agent has seen it and she said it was really good. I don’t know what it is, but I don’t really watch it like I’m watching a normal show. I just watch it because I’m in it. So, I don’t know. But everyone who has spoken to me has said it’s amazing. So yeah, I’ve heard positive things."
Each episode of "Adolescence" was shot in one take – a challenge for any actor. But Cooper said in a video for Netflix that if he could, he would always film in that style.
"Because when you're like cutting and stopping and stuff, you wouldn't get that full — you wouldn't get the full emotion," he said.
Cooper told Vogue that he only had two weeks to learn all the lines.
“I still question how I did that, to be honest ... There was so much highlighting you could barely read the lines," he said.
What have the cast and creators of 'Adolescence' said about Owen Cooper?

Stephen Graham, the series' co-creator, co-writer and star, told TODAY producers auditioned “over 500 young boys” for the part of Jamie. They wanted to cast an unknown actor to “create an opportunity for someone," he said — and Cooper was the perfect fit.
“He came and he was off book, he’s just phenomenal,” Graham said.
Cooper's first day on set was filming Episode 3, a conversation between Jamie and therapist Briony Ariston (Erin Doherty).

The scene took 11 takes and resulted in a harrowing performance from Cooper. In the scene, Jamie appears to unmask himself and show how he might be capable of taking someone's life. Doherty called the performance "genuinely scary."

"I’m so proud of Owen because I got to see him push himself as an actor, to really go there," she said. "Back then, he was this kid and he didn’t want to be this scary thing, especially with someone he just met. So, we really had to work on creating this safe space to let him know that he’s going to be fine. To think about that kid versus the one that turned up in that 11th take, and push those buttons and pushed himself, I’m just so proud."
In an interview with Vanity Fair, Graham compared Cooper's performance in "Adolescence" to Ed Norton's breakout in "Primal Fear," and said that Cooper reminded him of a young Jodie Comer.

“What I saw in Owen was the exact same thing I saw in Jodie Comer when Jodie was 17," he said. “I saw the same kind of ability, the same kind of natural talent, and just a real presence ... He just blew my mind.”
"Adolescence" director Philip Barantini praised Cooper’s performance to Variety, saying, “Actors train for years and years and still can’t really master what Owen has done.”
What's next for Owen Cooper?
The actor already has two more roles lined up.

Cooper is set to appear as Callum in an upcoming TV miniseries called "Film Club" which is about sparks flying between two film club members. It's set to debut this year on BBC iPlayer and BBC Three and is written by Aimee Lou Wood, who is currently starring in Season 3 of "The White Lotus."

Cooper has also been tapped to play young Heathcliff in Emerald Fennell's adaptation of "Wuthering Heights." The older version of Heathcliff will be played by Jacob Elordi, starring opposite Margot Robbie as Catherine Earnshaw.
Cooper told Variety that Graham helped him land the role of Healthcliff. Graham recommended Cooper to his agent, then gave the agent Episode 1 of "Adolescence" to watch.
"I got 'Wuthering Heights' from that!" Cooper said.

title: Tiger Woods confirms relationship with Vanessa Trump, the former daughter-in-law of President Trump
summary: Tiger Woods has confirmed his relationship with Vanessa Trump, the ex-wife of Donald Trump Jr. Here's what to know about their relationship.
story: Tiger Woods has confirmed his relationship with Vanessa Trump, the ex-wife of Donald Trump Jr. and former daughter-in-law of President Donald Trump.
The golfing champion posted two photos of himself and Vanessa Trump on his Instagram account on March 23.

"Love is in the air and life is better with you by my side! We look forward to our journey through life together," Woods wrote in the caption. "At this time we would appreciate privacy for all those close to our hearts."
Vanessa Trump, 47, was married to Donald Trump Jr. from 2005 to 2018, and the pair share five children.

One of Vanessa Trump's children, Kai, attends the same school as Woods' two children, Sam and Charlie, NBC News reported. Charlie Woods has played golf alongside his father, and against TODAY's own Carson Daly and his son, Jackson.
Woods, 49, shares his two children with his ex-wife, Elin Nordegren. The pair were married from 2004 to 2010, and divorced after Woods' extra-marital affairs, which he admitted to publicly in 2009.

Earlier this month, Woods announced he had underwent surgery to repair a ruptured Achilles tendon, which would likely keep him out of any major championships like the Masters this year, the Associated Press reported.

Before his surgery, Woods was spotted playing golf with the president in February at the Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, Florida. President Trump awarded Woods the Presidential Medal of Freedom during his first term in 2019.
"There are no winners like you," Trump told Woods during the 2019 ceremony.

title: Is there a new episode of ‘The Voice’ on tonight, March 24? How to watch
summary: Is there a new episode of "The Voice on tonight, March 24? What to know about the singing competition show.
story: The battles round is about to come to a close.
After two weeks of intense musical duels, “The Voice” will soon move on to the knockouts round. But first, contestants have to make it through this last week of battles.

With each passing week, Season 27 hopefuls move one step closer to advancing in the NBC singing competition. When does the next episode air and what happened last week? Here's everything you need to know.
Is there a new episode of ‘The Voice’ on March 24, 2025?

Yes, viewers can watch a new episode of "The Voice" on Monday, March 24. It will air live on NBC at 8 p.m. ET/PT and 7 p.m. CT and can be streamed the next day on Peacock, on March 25. NBC and Peacock are owned by NBCUniversal, TODAY.com's parent company.
What will happen in tonight’s episode of ‘The Voice’?

The March 24 episode of "The Voice" will show the third and final battles round, which requires all four coaches — Michael Bublé, Kelsea Ballerini, Adam Levine and John Legend —  to ask two of their team members to sing the same song. In the end, only one singer can move on, unless one coach wants to save or steal them.
What happened during last week’s episode of ‘The Voice’?
The March 17 episode of “The Voice” featured the second night of the battles round.

Legend had Bryson Battle and Ari Camille face off with singing Muni Long's song "Made for Me." Ultimately, Battle won, but Camille is still sticking around after Levine used one of his steals to scoop her up.
The "All of Me" singer also tasked two of his other artists, BD.ii and Antonio Ramsey, with singing Musiq Soulchild’s “Just Friends (Sunny).” BD.ii took home the win and remained on Legend's team.

On Bublé's team, Barry Jean Fontenot and Kaiya Hamilton went head-to-head while singing Solomon Burke's "Cry to Me." In the end, Hamilton won, and Ballerini tried to steal Fontenot while Bublé used his save to try to keep him on his team. Ultimately, Fontenot decided to stick by Bublé's side.

From Ballerini's team, Jaelen Johnston and Hailey Wright sang “Neon Moon” by Brooks & Dunn. Ballerini chose Johnston to move on to the next round. Alanna Lynise and Brook Wood from Ballerini’s team sang Miley Cyrus’ “Angels Like You," and Ballerini selected Lynise as the winner.
As for Levine's team, Hayden Grove and Lucia Flores-Wiseman competed against each other with singing Frank Sinatra's "Funny Valentine." In the end, Levine chose Flores-Wiseman to move on.

title: What to know about Jenna Bush Hager’s twin sister, Barbara Bush
summary: Learn all about the woman who's been by the side of the TODAY With Jenna & Friends host since the beginning.
story: Jenna Bush Hager has had a partner in life since the day she was born. Well, actually even before that.
It’s her twin, Barbara Bush, whom she lovingly calls “Sissy.”

“I don’t know life without this beautiful, giving gorgeous soul — and wouldn’t want to,” the TODAY With Jenna & Friends host wrote in an Instagram post, marking their shared birthday. “I’m the luckiest to be born walking through life side-by-side with the small girl with the largest heart.”
Get to know Jenna’s sister, from bonding with Jenna to the ways she stands out in her own spotlight, below.
Barbara Bush is a fraternal twin
Former President George W. Bush and first lady Laura Bush, who married in 1977, wanted to start a family. On Nov. 25, 1981, their wish came true with the birth of twins.

Just before Thanksgiving, they found themselves with so much to be thankful for: Barbara (named for her father’s mother, Barbara Pierce Bush) and Jenna (named for her mother’s mother, Jenna Hawkins Welch) were welcomed into the world.
As the former first lady put it during a 2019 visit to TODAY, “There was one baby for me to hold and one baby for George to hold, which was great.”
She and her sister were best friends from the beginning
The former first lady saw having twins as beneficial for her girls.
“I was so happy that they had a sister from the day they were born, since I was an only child and always wished I had sisters or brothers,” she added during the same appearance.

In the foreword to Jenna and Barbara’s 2017 book, “Sisters First: Stories From Our Wild and Wonderful Life,” Mom described how devoted the girls are to each other, calling them instant “playmates, confidantes, cheerleaders, sounding boards and dreamers.”
She is protective of her twin sister
From their earliest days, Jenna recalls Barbara having her back — even on their first flight without their parents at the age of 7.

“On the flight, we got into an argument as sisters do,” Jenna noted on Instagram. “I was most likely more aggressive. After a while, the man seated on the aisle said, looking at my sister: ‘Are you going to hit her or should I?’ And that ended our fight. We were a team again. She — protecting me — put her little arm around my shoulder. No one was going to hurt her sister. And that’s my sister: all heart and all action.”
She and her sister left their marks on the White House
Barbara and Jenna were college students when their parents moved into the White House in 2001. While there, they left their mark on the residence — or rather, in one of the gardens.
Their handprints are featured in the Children’s Garden, alongside those of other children and grandchildren of past presidents.
She married Craig Louis Coyne in 2018
On Oct. 7, 2018, Barbara wed screenwriter Craig Louis Coyne at her family’s Walker Point compound in Maine.
“It was a very secret wedding, a little bit like my elusive sister,” Jenna later shared on TODAY. “But also, just family in a place that means family love, and it was just beautiful.”
Jenna served as matron of honor at the nuptials, just as Barbara did for Jenna at her 2008 wedding to Henry Hager.
She’s a mother of 2
Barbara and Craig welcomed their first child, a daughter named Cora Georgia Coyne, to the world in September 2021. The little one’s middle name was inspired by her famous grandfather.
In August 2024, the couple expanded their family when they had a son, Edward Finn Coyne.
“My sissy had a little mister and I fell madly in love with Edward Finn!” Jenna wrote in an announcement shared on social media.
From health activist to author

After graduating from Yale University with a bachelor’s in humanities then earning a master’s in public administration from Harvard Kennedy School, Barbara co-founded the Global Health Corps, a nonprofit organization that focuses on health equity for all.
Barbara is also an author, sharing several titles with her sister.
Inspired by their 2017 shared biography, the pair released a series of children’s books: “Sisters First,” “Love Comes First” and “I Loved You First.”

title: All about Jenna Bush Hager’s parents, George and Laura Bush
summary: Take a closer look at the former first couple, who raised the TODAY With Jenna & Friends host.
story: Jenna Bush Hager has been part of the TODAY family since 2009, but she’s been part of another famous family for far longer.
The TODAY With Jenna & Friends host, along with her twin sister, Barbara Bush, is, of course, the offspring of former President George W. Bush and former first lady Laura Bush.
They helped shape the person she is, and to understand her better, you need only take a closer look at the people who brought her into the world. Read on to learn all about them.
Early days for him
George Walker Bush, the first child of George Herbert Walker Bush and Barbara Pierce Bush, was born July 6, 1946, in New Haven, Connecticut. He was raised in Midland, Texas.
He graduated from Yale University with a bachelor’s in history before earning his MBA from Harvard Business School. In between his degrees, he served in the Texas Air National Guard.
After Harvard, George W. Bush went into business, creating the oil and gas exploration firm Arbusto Energy.
Early days for her
Laura Bush, born Laura Lane Welch, was the only child of Harold and Jenna Welch. She was born Nov. 4, 1946, in Midland, Texas.

She attended Southern Methodist University and received her bachelor’s in education. She went on to become an elementary school teacher before going back to school and earning her master’s in library science from the University of Texas at Austin.
She went on to work as a librarian in the Austin Independent School District.
A whirlwind romance
In July 1977, a 31-year-old George W. Bush was introduced to a 30-year-old Laura Welch at a barbecue thrown by their mutual friends.

“The moment I saw Laura’s blue eyes I felt heart palpitations,” he recalled in a 2021 Wall Street Journal feature about the couple. “She was a beautiful, stately woman. A little shy but very engaging.”
That initial attraction was mutual.
“I thought George was cute,” she noted in the same story. “Mainly he liked to talk and I liked to listen.”
They began dating, and when he popped the question a few months later, she “didn’t have to think twice about it.”
Saying their ‘I do’s’
On Nov. 5, 1977, four months after meeting, the couple wed at the First United Methodist Church in Midland.
In his 2010 book, “Decision Points,” the groom referred to the nuptials as “the best decision of my life.”
On the campaign trail

George W.’s next big decision was to follow in the political footsteps of his father, George H.W. Bush. In 1978, George W. ran for congressional office, and though he didn’t win a seat in the House, he did find that he had the perfect stumping partner in Laura Bush, who would remain at his side throughout his political career.
Becoming parents
Though the Bushes knew they wanted children, it didn’t happen for them as quickly as they’d hoped. But when it did, they were able to make up for lost time.
On Nov. 25, 1981, they welcomed twin daughters, Jenna and Barbara Bush.

“The best part was actually getting two babies with one pregnancy,” Laura shared during a 2019 visit to TODAY With Hoda & Jenna. “We were very anxious for children. Then, of course, there was one baby for me to hold and one baby for George to hold, which was great.”
She went on to explain how their double blessing came with bonus challenges as the years went on.
“During their teenage years, George just said, ‘War is hell,’” she noted with a grin. “To have two 13-year-old girls at the same was wild."
From the Governor’s Mansion to the White House
George ran for governor of Texas in 1994 and won. It was a feat he repeated four years later, but he didn’t serve his full second term.
That’s because, in 2001, he once again followed in his father’s political footsteps — all the way to the highest office in the land.
George and Laura called the White House home for eight years.
Devoted grandparents
The former first family has continued to grow over the years, with  George and Laura now grandparents.

Jenna and her husband, Henry Hager, have welcomed three children of their own — daughters Poppy and Mila, and son Hal. Meanwhile, Barbara and her husband, Craig Coyne, have two — daughter Cora and son Edward.

“We let them do anything, of course,” Laura said during a 2019 TODAY visit. “And the part we love the best is when we’re with (the grandchildren) at the ranch or we’re with them in Maine, is they sneak out of their bedrooms at 6 in the morning and rush in to get in bed with us. We love that!”
She also insisted Grandpa is a pushover when it comes to the grandkids.
“As George says, ‘They can do whatever they want, eat whatever they want.’”
According to Jenna, it can take “a full week” to get the kids back to their usual schedules after spending quality time with their grandparents.

title: Jaclyn and Laurie’s ‘White Lotus’ confrontation, explained by star Michelle Monaghan
summary: Michelle Monaghan breaks down Jaclyn and Laurie’s ‘White Lotus’ fight in Episode 6 which happens after Jaclyn sleeps with Valentin.
story: Warning: This post contains spoilers for Season 3 of “The White Lotus.”
A fresh piece of gossip has hit the trio of longtime friends on vacation on Season 3 of “The White Lotus”: Jaclyn hooked up with one of the hotel’s wellness gurus, Valentin.
But this time, instead of talking behind each other’s backs, Laurie (Carrie Coon) confronts Jaclyn (Michelle Monaghan) about the betrayal in Episode 6 of the hit HBO show.
Monaghan tells TODAY.com she thinks the tense scene comes as a shock to her character Jaclyn.
“I think for Jaclyn, it was a pretty big surprise how upset Laurie was. I mean, Laurie really considers it a betrayal of sorts,” Monaghan says.

“I think for Jaclyn — from my perspective and from Jaclyn’s perspective, I think she was just having fun. Laurie didn’t hook up with him. I think Jaclyn was really sincere, like, ‘You should hook up with him!’”
Monaghan adds she thinks Jaclyn’s decision to hook up with Valentin was “very impulsive.”

“I don’t think it was malicious. I think it was something that she was probably going to tell the ladies the next morning, and be like, ‘You guys, guess what I did last night!’ Not thinking that it was going to be such a sore point, a pain point for them,” she says.

“And so when Laurie does call her out on her choice to do this, it becomes very clear that Jaclyn has done something that might be irreparable to this friendship,” she continues. “So she immediately puts her guard up. It will be interesting how (Episodes) 7 and 8 play out.”
The friend group drama began when Kate (Leslie Bibb) sees Valentin (Arnas Fedaravičius) leaving their villa early in the morning, waving bye to Jaclyn.
Kate immediately tells Laurie the news over breakfast. Laurie is angry, as Jaclyn had been encouraging her to hook up with Valentin all week as a rebound from her divorce.

While the trio is lounging at the pool, Laurie whispers to Kate that she has to say something to Jaclyn. The pair go back and forth about bringing it up, before Jaclyn asks what they are talking about.
“We know about Valentin,” Laurie says.
“What about him?” Jaclyn replies.
“That he spent the night,” Laurie says. “Well, how was it?”
Jaclyn says that nothing happened, and Laurie says that whatever happens in Thailand, stays in Thailand.
“I told you, nothing happened,” Jaclyn says, more forcefully.
Laurie says she needs a drink and asks for three margaritas before she starts the real confrontation.
“Can I just ask, and I’m just curious, why did you keep pushing him on me? When it was always your plan to hook up with him yourself?” Laurie asks.
Jaclyn says she never had a plan to do anything, and that she thought Laurie was mad since she was coming at her.
Laurie then reveals it was Kate who told her she saw Valentin coming out of Jaclyn’s room.
“It’s like nobody ever changes,” she says. “We’re still in the tenth grade — it’s just funny.”
Jaclyn pulls out her book, but Laurie isn’t done.
“This is what you always did. Never mind, forget it, it doesn’t matter,” Laurie says, putting her sunglasses back on.
Monaghan says she thinks the trio’s friendship exemplifies the reality, and complexity, of friend groups.

“The ladies all have something going on personally. But they’re turning up to this vacation feeling like they want to put their best foot forward, and so they distract themselves from what’s really going on by talking about some of the failures or some of the successes of each other,” she says. “I think that’s an easy trope for some people to fall into, and I think folks are finding it very relatable.”

Monaghan credits the show's creator, Mike White, with choosing to explore how female friendships operate in this season of the show.

“I think he really wanted to tackle the idea of how women do constantly compare each other to everyone based on, again, failures and successes, and how we endure that as women and how painful that is,” she says. “And also how we perpetuate it as well.”
Jaclyn, Laurie and Kate’s friend group has been the subject of many memes as the season has gone on, from Kate’s forced smile to the instant gossiping that happens once one of the three is gone.
Monaghan says she’s seen some of the memes.

“I think what I didn’t expect was how much fun fans are going to have. I underestimated how much fun this part of the process would be — it’s such a fun journey,” she says. “I just love how invested they are in the show and in the conversation around it. I’m enjoying it as much as everyone else.”

title: Patrick Schwarzenegger’s reaction to Saxon and Lochlan in ‘White Lotus’ Episode 6: ‘My mouth was on the floor’
summary: Patrick Schwarzenegger shares his reaction to Saxon and Lochlan's threesome in The White Lotus Season 3, Episode 6.
story: Warning: This post contains spoilers for Season 3 of “The White Lotus.”
Turns out that brotherly kiss between Saxon and Lochlan Ratliff in Season 3 of "The White Lotus" led to much, much more.

In Episode 6, the brothers slowly start to remember moments from their blackout after spending the night at the Full Moon Party, only to realize that they had an full-on threesome together with Greg's girlfriend, Chloe.
Patrick Schwarzenegger, who plays Saxon on the hit HBO show, tells TODAY.com that when he read the script for the episode, his “mouth was on the floor.”

“I think when you sign on to do ‘The White Lotus,’ you’re always expecting something crazy is going to happen,” he says. “You never know if it’s going to be your character or not. Of course, I have full trust in Mike White as a writer and director and showrunner — I lean into anything that he wants to do.

“I think that he only writes things that serve a purpose for the story and for the characters’ arc and journey,” Schwarzenegger continues. “When I read it, my mouth was on the floor. Honestly, I was shocked. Yeah, I’m sure audiences will be shocked.”
Saxon is the first brother to realize something else happened, besides their kiss, on Greg's yacht after the Full Moon Party.

Saxon appears nauseated on the top deck of the yacht, and has another flashback to the threesome. It's then that Lochlan (Sam Nivola) approaches and tells Saxon he doesn’t remember anything from the night before.
Saxon then walks, with an awkwardly wide stance, away from Lochlan, before running to the bathroom and throwing up.

The brothers get back to the hotel, where their sister Piper and parents are getting ready to head to the monastery to speak to the monk who Piper wants to study under. Piper asks Lochlan to come with them while Saxon stays back to drink his protein shake.
Saxon goes to the pool where he runs into Chelsea, who tells him he is "soulless." Chloe later joins them at the pool and she asks him about the night before.
Saxon says it was "a joke" when he kissed his brother and that the girls forced them to kiss.
"I didn't force him to jerk you off," Chloe replies, to Saxon's disbelief — at first denying it, before saying he doesn't remember that happening.
"I blacked out," Saxon says.
"Well, I didn't ... so," Chloe replies, as Chelsea's eyes get wide.
Saxon looks visibly sick as he asks what drugs he took at the Full Moon Party.
"I don't think there's a drug in the world that would make me get with my brother," Chelsea says.

Saxon then heads back to his room. Meanwhile, at the monastery, flashes of the night come back to Lochlan as he's in a meditation session with his sister and the events of the night before come back to him.

The episode ends with the brothers still separated, meaning the fallout from the night is still yet to come. Lochlan is spending the night at the monastery and Saxon, along with his parents, is heading to Greg's for a dinner party.
Schwarzenegger previously told TODAY.com he credited the show's creator, Mike White, with how the kissing scene in Episode 5 came together.

“He wants to leave that up to the interpretation of the audience of what is happening,” Schwarzenegger said of White. “Was a power shift happening? Is there a different power dynamic between him and Lochy? Is Lochy coming on to him? Is it the drugs? Is it the girls pressuring him? What is it? So, I think he leaves that open-ended for the audience to try to decipher.”
While the kiss was up for debate, fans of "The White Lotus" are sure to have opinions on the incestuous threesome.

title: Jennifer Coolidge says 'The White Lotus' changed her dating life
summary: Jennifer Coolidge’s explains how her portrayal of Tanya on “The White Lotus” not only revived her acting career, but improved her love life, as well.
story: Jennifer Coolidge’s Emmy-winning portrayal of Tanya on “The White Lotus” not only revived her acting career, but it improved her love life, as well.

The 63-year-old opened up in an interview with the Sunday Times about how her life has changed since landing a starring role on “The White Lotus.” While chatting with the British newspaper, Coolidge reflected on her breakout role in “American Pie” in 1999 and said now, fans recognize her for her character in the hit HBO series.

“Even though I play a complete weirdo in ‘White Lotus,’ cute guys come up to me. And this is far better than ‘American Pie’ because people were really sad about Tanya falling off a boat,” she said, referencing the death of her character in Season Two of the series.
“These men like you better because they feel that you went through something," she said. "That show really upped my game!”
After playing Stifler’s Mom in “American Pie,” Coolidge said she received many “benefits” when the coming-of-age comedy became a success.
She later landed memorable roles in movies like “Legally Blonde,” “Zoolander” and “A Cinderella Story.” But eventually the interest waned, and the type of parts she was offered became limited.

She faults herself. The actor said she enjoyed her time in the spotlight, but then her focus shifted and she "dilly-dallied." Coolidge advises actors trying to break into the industry to learn from her mistakes.

“I sabotaged myself, and I’d say this to any young person: when the wave comes, have the guts to stay on. I would beg people to, you know, blow off your wedding and take that job,” she told the Sunday Times. “I was a sure bet, I got so many good jobs in a row. I have huge regrets — I was deeply depressed for a very long time.”
She explained that at the time, she prioritized a guy in her life that she wanted to pursue.
“I wanted him to like me, so I went completely off-track. I wasted a lot of time — and that moment passes. And, God, if I could live my life over again, I wouldn’t have done what I did,” she said.

“It was guys and, well, everyone wants certain things in their life at a certain time. I was trying to have relationships with men who were unavailable, or there are guys out there who really hate women deep down and I certainly dated them,” she added.

Over the years, the extended lull in her career also continued to affect her dating pool. She recalled a man approaching her on the street in New Orleans and asking her out before she was cast on “The White Lotus.”

“It was a few years ago and he had a T-shirt on that his belly came out of, plus red cowboy boots. He was 4 feet, 11 inches, and he said, ‘Would you like to go out?’” Coolidge said. “And, well, there was nothing wrong with him, but you have this idea that Brad Pitt or whoever will sweep you off your feet, and then it was that little …”
She added, “And ‘White Lotus’ changed that for me. It’s not just that little guy any more.”
Currently, she is still searching for her perfect match, she said.
Speaking of the HBO series, it returned last month for its third season, the first without Coolidge. So, how does she feel about Season Three so far?
“It’s eerie, creepy, I’m worried for everybody,” she said, having only seen two episodes of Season Three at the time. “Greg (Jon Gries) is in the first episode! I hope something bad happens to him.”
As for her reaction when she found out last year that Tanya — the fan-favorite character who helped her earn two Emmys, a Golden Globe and more — wouldn’t return for the next season?
“You have to be a good sport about it, but I went, ‘Oh, really? Really?’ I whined and then just let it go,” she recalled.
Next up for Coolidge: She will star in “A Minecraft Movie” with Jason Momoa, Jack Black, Kate McKinnon and Danielle Brooks. The film arrives in theaters April 4.

title: Jodie Sweetin and Andrea Barber agree this 1 ‘Full House’ episode is ‘the worst’
summary: Jodie Sweetin and Andrea Barber are ranking Season 1 “Full House” episodes, sharing the best, worst and funniest on their podcast.
story: Jodie Sweetin and Andrea Barber are looking back at their days on “Full House” and spilling some secrets about the beloved sitcom, like the one episode they dislike the most.

In 2023, Sweetin and Barber launched a “Full House” rewatch podcast called “How Rude, Tanneritos!” The name references the iconic lines their characters, Stephanie Tanner and Kimmy Gibbler, repeated on the show. For nearly two years, the former child actors have been recapping and reminiscing on episodes from the series, which ran for eight seasons from 1987-1995.

But for a special “minisode” of the podcast March 21, the duo decided to play a game that fans suggested on Reddit. Longtime “Full House” viewers wanted Sweetin and Barber to rank episodes from Season 1, including the best, worst, funniest and more. They posted a snippet of their responses on Instagram.
To kick off the superlative game, the actors decided to reveal their least favorite episode, and they quickly agreed that one stood out to them for the wrong reasons.
They counted to three before they shared at the same time that “Sea Cruise,” the fifth episode of Season 1, was the worst of the bunch.

In the episode, Stephanie, Michelle (Mary-Kate Olsen and Ashley Olsen) and D.J. (Candace Cameron Bure) visit their grandmother, while Danny (Bob Saget), Joey (Dave Coulier) and Jesse (John Stamos) decide to board a fishing yacht for a men-only bonding day.
Barber described “Sea Cruise” as “easily the worst episode” in the comedy’s entire run.
“I don’t think there’s been a worse episode since ‘Sea Cruise,’” she continued. “I think ‘Sea Cruise’ takes the cake for all seasons.”

Sweetin agreed and added that the “weird Michelle dream sequence” from “Bye, Bye Birdie” in Season 3 “was also creepy.” She also wasn’t a fan of the episodes featuring Howie Anderson, Becky’s (Lori Loughlin) nephew.
“But, again, not as bad as ‘Sea Cruise,’” Sweetin said.
They then moved onto the best episode of Season 1. They agreed that the pilot, the first episode of the series, remains their favorite.

“I’m going to go out on a limb and say the ‘Full House’ pilot is one of the best pilots in sitcom history,” Barber said, making Sweetin gasp. “It had everything. You immediately know who the characters are, you know their personalities, you know their relationships with each other (and) you know the challenges that they face. It has heart. It’s funny. It has it all, and it has stood the test of time for the last 37 years.”

Sweetin replied, “You know what, you’re right. I’ll give you that.” She pointed out that there were possibly other episodes that had better storylines, but the pilot, which was titled “Our Very First Show,” is unforgettable.

“That pilot, I can picture it so vividly, and I know our Fanneritos can as well. Like, what we were wearing (and) what we were doing…That episode is such a memory, such a great episode,” Sweetin said.
Barber named “Our Very First Show” as the funniest episode, too. Sweetin also listed “Sisterly Love” and “A Pox in Our House” from Season 1 as other hilarious episodes.
After handing out other superlatives, Sweetin and Barber told their listeners that they will continue to reveal their personal best and worst episodes for each season.

title: When does ‘The White Lotus’ air? How to watch Season 3, Episode 6
summary: When is the White Lotus on on Sunday, March 23? Here's what to know about Season 3, Episode 6 of The White Lotus and what time it's on and how to watch.
story: Episode 6 of "The White Lotus" is nearly here — and we're still reeling from the last one.
Among the shockers? Sam Rockwell's surprise cameo and unforgettable monologue. Bonus trivia: Rockwell is married in real life to one of the Season 3 stars, Leslie Bibb.
Then, there was that kiss between brothers Saxon (Patrick Schwarzenegger) and Lochlan (Sam Nivola) shared while partying with two other hotel guests.
Schwarzenegger spoke about the scene, and why "White Lotus" creator Mike White wanted to make it deliberately unsettling, in a previous interview with TODAY.com.

“He wants to leave that up to the interpretation of the audience of what is happening,” Schwarzenegger says of White. “Was a power shift happening? Is there a different power dynamic between him and Lochy? Is Lochy coming on to him? Is it the drugs? Is it the girls pressuring him? What is it? So, I think he leaves that open-ended for the audience to try to decipher.”
Here’s how to catch every detail of Episode 6, including what’s to come and what you missed last time.
What time does the new episode of ‘The White Lotus’ air?
Season 3, Episode 6 of “The White Lotus” will air on Sunday, March 23 at 9 p.m. ET/PT.
Where to watch ‘The White Lotus’
“The White Lotus” Season 3, Episode 6 will air live on HBO and drop on Max simultaneously for streaming.
How many episodes of ‘The White Lotus’ are left?
There are three episodes left of Season 3, including Episode 6.
Season 1 had six episodes, Season 2 had seven episodes, but Season 3 has increased to a total of eight episodes.
The final episode of "The White Lotus" Season 3 will air on April 6.
What else happened last week during Season 3, Episode 5?
The episode picked up exactly where Episode 4 left off, beginning with Gaitok (Tayme Thapthimthong) discovering that Timothy Ratliff (Jason Isaacs) had stolen his gun.
Gaitok goes to confront Timothy, eventually asking for it back, but Timothy claims he doesn't know what he's talking about.

At dinner after the boat day, Piper Ratliff (Sarah Catherine Hook) drops the news that she's not in Thailand to work on a thesis. In reality, she's a Buddhist and plans to move to Thailand to develop her spirituality for at least a year. Her mother, Victoria Ratliff (Parker Posey), does not take well.

Meanwhile, on the boat headed to the Full Moon Party, Saxon Ratliff (Patrick Schwarzenegger) tells Lochlan Ratliff (Sam Nivola) that he needs to gain confidence to get what he wants. Also on the boat, Chloe (Charlotte Le Bon) tells Chelsea (Aimee Lou Wood) that she likes young guys, confessing that she and Greg (Jon Gries) are never intimate. Chelsea says she could never cheat on Rick (Walton Goggins).

Rick, however, isn't picking up Chelsea's calls as he is in Bangkok meeting an old friend, Frank (Sam Rockwell). Frank tells Rick that he's sober now. He launches on a monologue about his fetishes and desires that leaves Rick speechless. Then he says he's since given that lifestyle up for Buddhism. After revealing his story, he hands Rick a black bag containing a gun, telling him he hopes he doesn't have to use it.

Jaclyn (Michelle Monaghan), Laurie (Carrie Coon) and Kate (Leslie Bibb) are at a club with Valentin (Arnas Fedaravičius) and his friends Vlad (Yuri Kolokolnikov) and Aleksei (Julian Kostov). They dance, they drink, they party. Valentin seems to actually like Laurie, flirting with her throughout the evening. Their group of six ends up returning to the women's villa, despite Kate wishing the men would leave. There, they continue to party, with Laurie even taking her swimsuit off. Once Kate finally convinces all the men to leave, the women go to sleep — except Jaclyn who, unbeknownst to her friends, sneaks Valentin back in and the two have sex.

Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) spends the episode in high stress when the manager Fabian (Christian Friedel) informs her that Greg has been asking questions about her. Belinda tells Fabian that Greg is dangerous and killed his wife, begging him to call the police, but Fabian refuses, saying that Greg's inquiry about her was harmless.
That night, Belinda also confides her fears to Pornchai (Dom Hetrakul) who believes her and agrees to spend the night in her room, so she won't be as scared. The two share a kiss.

Saxon, Lochlan, Chloe and Chelsea make it to the Full Moon Party, where Chloe offers them all drugs. Saxon refuses, but Lochlan immediately downs the drugs. Chelsea takes them and eventually the group convinces Saxon too as well.

After the Full Moon Party, the foursome goes back to the boat, where Chloe asks Chelsea if Rick would kill her if she cheated, adding that she thinks Greg (whom she calls Gary) is capable of killing her. But Chloe says she still wants to hook up with Lochlan, saying it's worth the risk.

With a booze and drugs in their systems, Saxon points at Chloe and Chelsea to kiss, which they do. Saxon then directs Chloe and Lochlan to kiss, which they do, too. Then, Chloe directs Saxon and Lochlan to kiss. Lochlan leans in and pecks Saxon on the lips. Saxon looks confused and says, "What?" But Lochlan goes in for a second, longer kiss with his brother. Afterwards, Saxon seems confused and disturbed.

The episode ends with Timothy Ratliff writing a suicide note. He puts Gaitok's gun up to his head but struggles to pull the trigger. Before he can, Victoria interrupts him. He hides the gun and note, telling her he will come back to bed soon. He then prays to God asking for advice on what to do.
What’s in store for the Season 3, Episode 5?
In the teaser clip for Episode 6, Belinda references a "Scarface" quote, which plays over montage of characters struggling with their own vices.
"First you get the money, then you get the power, then you get the woman," she says, as clips flash up of Timothy Ratliff, Greg Hunt and then Saxon Ratliff and Chelsea, respectively.

Belinda's son, Zion (Nicholas Duvernay), has finally arrived. Meanwhile, Greg tells Chloe that he needs to "deal with something" and requests her help. Chloe later tells Saxon that Greg knows about him.
Kate asks Laurie why she is "antagonizing her," seemingly referring to Jaclyn as the "her." Laurie says she just has to be "honest" sometimes.
Rick tells Frank he needs 10 minutes with someone and needs Frank's help to get it. The trailer ends with Timothy Ratliff pointing a gun.

title: Dolly Parton told Sabrina Carpenter to not break this rule on their ‘Please Please Please’ collab
summary: When Dolly Parton joined forced with Sabrina Carpenter to collaborate on “Please Please Please,” the country legend said she had one major condition.
story: When Dolly Parton joined forced with Sabrina Carpenter to collaborate on “Please Please Please,” the country legend said she had one major condition.
In an interview with Knox News, Parton said Carpenter, who is known for her colorful language, had to dial it back in order for them to come together on the song.

“Of course, she can talk a little bad now and then,” Parton said of Carpenter. “I told her, I said, ‘Now, I don’t cuss. I don’t make fun of Jesus. I don’t talk bad about God, and I don’t say dirty words, on camera, but known to if I get mad enough.’”
Carpenter released the deluxe version of her “Short n’ Sweet” album Feb. 14, which featured the new rendition of “Please, Please, Please” with Parton.
In their joint rendition, the lyrics changed from “I beg you, don’t embarrass me, motherf-----” to “I beg you, don’t embarrass me like the others.”
The same day as the updated album release, the pair dropped a black-and-white music video for "Please, Please, Please."
In the clip, Carpenter and Parton are driving around singing in a truck together, carrying a man who seemingly wronged the pop singer. The video has over 11 million views on YouTube.
In response to working with Carpenter, Parton said the 25-year-old was “so sweet.”
